moves.4... Nf6 5. Nc3 d6 6. Nxc6 bxc6 7. Bc4 g:
I didn't want to double my pawns here and trade the queen to lose my castling privileges. 
UPDATE: Ragozin has pointed out that 8. dxe5 is even worse after Bxf7 Kxf7 Qxd8!
moves.9. e6 f5: I couldn't take the pawn as I would lose the knight.
moves.10. Qd4 Nf6: My rook was under attack and my knight was in no mans land, so I felt this was the best move.
moves.11... Bg7 12. O-O-O: Doubling up on the D file is always a good strategy.
moves.12... d5: Trying to claim the center while grabbing that undefended e pawn.
moves.13. Nxd5: But that was a blunder and my opponent gets momentum here!
moves.13... cxd5 14. Bxd5 Rb8: I had to save the rook.
moves.15. Bc6+: And my only move was to block with my bishop.
moves.17... Rxb2 18. Kxb2 Ne4+ 19. c3 Nxg5: Getting a pawn and a strong bishop for a rook that was under a lot of pressure.
moves.22. Qxd8+ Nxd8 23. Bb5: My pieces are cramped and my opponent has all of his pieces active.
moves.26. a4 Bf6 27. h4: If I take the h pawn my opponent will take the e pawn with his rook.
moves.27... Rb8: I couldn't see anything else to do.
moves.28. g3 h6 29. Rd5 Rd8: I don't want that pawn to advance if he doubles his rooks on the d file.
moves.30. Bc6 h5 31. a5: Now he's going to try to promote that pawn too. Great...
moves.31... Nc7: Threatening his rook and not allowing the a4 pawn advance.
moves.33. Bb7 f4: Creating some sort of counter play on the king side.
moves.34. g4 hxg4 35. fxg4 Ke6 36. c4 Bxh4: Attacking his king side is my only hope.
moves.38. Kb3: ?? Big blunder as it allows for a free bishop!
moves.38... Rb8 39. d8=N+: My opponent was probably going to lose this pawn anyway but the move is just a stall I believe.
moves.39... Bxd8 40. Rh8: While that move looks great, it becomes killer for my opponent later on.
moves.40... Rxb7+ 41. Ka4 Be7: getting my bishop out of harms way.
moves.42. Rc2: probably looking to push that pawn, but my opponent does not see the trap I have
moves.43. Ka3 Rb8+: Discovered check! Now after having a losing position I have completely turned the tables.
moves.44. Ka2 Rxh8 45. c5 Ra8: He cannot defend the a5 pawn.
moves.46. c6 Rxa5+ 47. Kb3 Rc5: He either trades or loses his pawn.
moves.51. Kd3 e4+ 52. Kxe4: Taking was a mistake, as it allows the promotion.
Now there is a forced mate in 3.
moves.57. Kh4 Qg3#: 3! I hope you enjoyed my game!

gameName: Coming back from a losing position!
